def_en: A window is a space in the wall of a building or in the side of a vehicle, which has glass in it so that light can come in and you can see out.

def_cn: (商店的)玻璃橱窗，陈列窗
def_en: A window is a large piece of glass along the front of a shop, behind which some of the goods that the shop sells are displayed.

def_cn: (银行、邮局、火车站、博物馆等处柜台的)窗口
def_en: A window is a glass-covered opening above a counter, for example in a bank, post office, railway station, or museum, which the person serving you sits behind.
On a computer screen, a window is one of the work areas that the screen can be divided into.

def_cn: (日程安排等中的)空当，空隙
def_en: If you have a window in your diary for something, or if you can make a window for it, you are free at a particular time and can do it then.
French window; picture window; rose window;

def_cn: 消失殆尽;烟消云散;化为乌有
def_en: If you say that something such as a plan or a particular way of thinking or behaving has gone out of the window or has flown out of the window, you mean that it has disappeared completely.

def_cn: 转瞬即逝的机会;稍纵即逝的机会
def_en: If you say that there is a window of opportunity for something, you mean that there is an opportunity to do something but that this opportunity will only last for a short time and so it needs to be taken advantage of quickly.
